title: 2020 Nissan Juke review – the worst car Nissan made is now one of the best
text:
If ever there was a Marmite car, the first-generation Nissan Juke is it. You either love it, or you hate it. And with its googly eyes, chubby cheeks, oddly sloping roofline and bulging haunches, plenty of people fall into that latter camp.

Then again, there are plenty of Juke fans out there, too. Along with its bigger brother, the Qashqai, the Juke has underpinned Nissan’s success in Europe ever since its launch in 2010; here in the UK, where the current model is built, we love it more than most, and snaffle up more than 25 per cent of the Juke’s European sales.

This despite very serious flaws: cramped rear seats and a tiny boot, lethargic engines, cheap’n’cheerful plastics, and a painfully...
description: If ever there was a Marmite car, the first-generation Nissan Juke is it.
